sen.e: He was the grandson of Hikoimasu no miko, who was the Imperial Prince of Emperor Kaika, and the ancestor of such local families in Ise Province as Honjibe (a unit of people in charge of the affaires related to Emperor Suinin's son, Homutsuwake no mikoto) and Sana no miyatsuko (local lord of Sana).

sen.j: 『古事記』によると、唖の誉津別命が出雲国に赴くさい、そのお供をするべき人物として占いに当たったので、曙立王がうけいをすると、一度死んだサギが蘇り、また一度枯れた樹木が蘇った。
sen.e: According to the Kojiki, when Homutsuwake no mikoto, who had speech impairment, was to go to Izumo Province, a divination recommended him to take Aketatsu no o as the attendant, and when Aketatsu no o practiced ukei (pledge), a dead サギ egret resuscitated and a dried trees recovered.

According to the Kojiki, when Homutsuwake no mikoto, who had speech impairment, left for Izumo Province for his new appointment, a divination recommended that he should take Aketatsu no o as an attendant, and when Aketatsu no o practiced ukei (pledge), a dead egret resuscitated and a dead tree recovered.
sen.cmt: 「サギ」の記述を削除。a dried trees を a dead treeに変更。その他表現の見直し。
sen.e: According to the Kojiki, when Homutsuwake no mikoto, who had speech impairment, left for Izumo Province for his new appointment, a divination recommended that he should take Aketatsu no o as an attendant, and when Aketatsu no o practiced ukei (pledge), a dead egret resuscitated and a dead tree recovered.

sen.j: そこで垂仁天皇は彼に大和師木登美豊朝倉曙立王という名を与え、さらに菟上王をもお供にして、出雲を訪問させたという。
sen.e: Therefore, Emperor Suinin gave him the name of Yamatoshi-kinotomino-toyoasakura no Aketatsu no miko, and dispatched him to Izumo as the prince's attendant together with another attendant, Unakami no o.
sen.cmt: 大和師木登美豊朝倉曙立王→Yamatoshi-kinotomino-toyoasakura no Aketatsu no mikoと長い名前です。
sen.e: Therefore, Emperor Suinin gave him the name of Yamatoshi-kinotomino-toyoasakura no Aketatsu no miko, and dispatched him to Izumo with a new attendant Unakami no o in addition to Akatatsu no o.

sen.j: 一説に曙立王が唖の皇子の伝承と関係を持っているのは、伊勢の佐那造がこれを語り伝えたためであるとされる。
sen.e: According to a theory, Aketatsu no o appears here in the Kojiki in relation with the legend of the speech impaired Imperial Prince, because this episode was created and handed down by the Sana no miyatsuko in Ise Province.

sen.j: 伊勢の佐那近辺は古来より水銀の産地として知られる。
sen.e: Sana area in Ise Province has been known as a production area of mercury since ancient times.

sen.j: 尾畑喜一郎は佐那造が古代の水銀採掘に携わった人々であるとし、気化した水銀を長時間呼吸することによって喉の病を患い、その職業病が誉津別命と曙立王の伝承を結びつけたとしている。
sen.e: Kiichiro OBATA argues that in ancient times, Sana no miyatsuko was the family in charge of mining mercury in this area, and the vaporized mercury was likely to have caused throat disorders among the people as a result of long-time aspiration of the material, and for this reason, this job-related disease came to connect the legendary Homutsuwake no mikoto with the tale of their ancestor Aketatsu no o.
